ygData.subject: Re: Group or Solo
ygData.msgSnippet: My guild and I exist on the Bristlebane server, and we are always more than happy to have another bard at our side.  I pity the foolish people that do not
ygData.messageBody:
My guild and I exist on the Bristlebane server, and we are always more than
happy to have another bard at our side. I pity the foolish people that do
not understand the value of a bard.

-----Original Message-----
From: Dan Harmon <deharmon@...>
To: eqbards@onelist.com <eqbards@onelist.com>
Date: Tuesday, July 13, 1999 4:49 PM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Group or Solo


>From: "Dan Harmon" <deharmon@...>
>
>I'm not as well travelled as you, server-speaking, but I am in a guild.
>Our guild seems rather friendly when it comes to having non-guild members
>group with us (on The Rathe). I know there are lots of jerk-guilds out
>there, but one thing you might try doing is asking a guild group that you
>see if they can use you. Chances are there's at least one bright person
in
>the group that knows the benefits of having a bard.
>
>
>> From: scott@... (scott brisko)
>>
>> I have noticied that there are far fewer people of a comparable level,
and
>> that many of the players belong to guilds of various natures. Perhaps
this
>> is a consequence of playing on a more established server where players
>have
>> had more time to develop their characters.
>
>
>
>--------------------------- ONElist Sponsor ----------------------------
>
>ONElist: your connection to people who share your interests.
>
>------------------------------------------------------------------------
